quote: Scriptures, n. The sacred books of our holy religion, as distinguished from the false and profane writings on which all other faiths are based.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: God is a book I can no longer read.
author: Floriano Martins

quote: The Bible is the greatest of all books; to study it is the noblest of all pursuits; to understand it, the highest of all goals.
author: Charles C. Ryrie

quote: Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book.
author: Stéphane Mallarmé

quote: I believe in books.
author: Carole Maso,  Room Lit By Roses

quote: The world exists to end up in a book.
author: Stéphane Mallarmé

quote: Book is book.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Each book was a world unto itself, and in it I took refuge.
author: Alberto Manguel,  A History of Reading

quote: A book of verses underneath the boughA flask of wine, a loaf of bread and thouBeside me singing in the wildernessAnd wilderness is paradise now.
author: Omar Khayyám,  Edward Fitzgerald's The Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam

quote: What can we see, read, acquire, but ourselves. Take the book, my friend, and read your eyes out, you will never find there what I find.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We live for books.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: I have more wisdom than any books ever written in history of times, any scripture ever written which you rhyme but this is not my purpose.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life.
author: Christopher Paolini,  Eragon

quote: The love of books is among the choicest gifts of the gods.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: The Word of God is my life's manual.
author: Jane Bulos

quote: Read books
author: Deliaha Hicks

quote: But I think the most important thing those books gave me was a kind of faith. My books promised me that life wasn’t just made up of workaday tasks and prosaic things. The world is bigger and more colorful and more important than that.
author: Laura Amy Schlitz,  The Hired Girl

quote: God is writing His story on the pages of our lives.
author: Rick Anderson

quote: Books are the mirrors of the soul.
author: Virginia Woolf,  Between the Acts

quote: A good book is an event in my life.
author: Stendhal,  The Red and the Black

quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
author: Umberto Eco,  The Name of the Rose

quote: Tongues in trees, books in running brooks, sermons in stones, and good in everything.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: They had only ever discussed books but what, in this life, is more personal than books?
author: Gabrielle Zevin,  The Storied Life of A.J. Fikry

quote: The Bible that is falling apart usually belongs to someone who isn't.
author: Kim Vogel Sawyer,  Courting Miss Amsel

quote: Books, I don't know what you see in them. I can understand a person reading them, but I can't for the life of me see why people have to write them.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Books are for nothing but to inspire
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: For some of us, books are as important as almost anything else on earth. What a miracle it is that out of these small, flat, rigid squares of paper unfolds world after world after world, worlds that sing to you, comfort and quiet or excite you. Books help us understand who we are and how we are to behave. They show us what community and friendship mean; they show us how to live and die.
author: Anne Lamott,  Bird by Bird: Some Instructions on Writing and Life

quote: I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: Books, the children of the brain.
author: Jonathan Swift,  A Tale Of A Tub And Other Writings

quote: Books are those faithful mirrors that reflect to our mind the minds of sages and heroes.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: We need the books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea inside us.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: I cannot live without books.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: ...Make God's Word your Sourcebook...
author: David Jeremiah,  Until Christ Returns: Living Faithfully Today While We Wait for Our Glorious Tomorrow

quote: I want an infinitely blank book and the rest of time.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quote: The only important thing in a book is the meaning that it has for you.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: If you love books enough, books will love you back.
author: Jo Walton,  Among Others

quote: The wise man reads both books and life itself.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Books remember all the things you cannot contain.
author: Elizabeth McCracken,  The Giant's House

quote: Books have a way of finding their way into our lives, usually, right when we need them the most.
author: Richard P. Denney

quote: Books are finite, sexual encounters are finite, but the desire to read and to fuck is infinite; it surpasses our own deaths, our fears, our hopes for peace.
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: It is books that are a key to the wide world; if you can't do anything else, read all that you can.
author: Jane Hamilton

quote: Old books that we have known but not possessed cross our path and invite themselves over. New books try to seduce us daily with tempting titles and tantalizing covers.
author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night

quote: The Bible has noble poetry in it... and some good morals and a wealth of obscenity, and upwards of a thousand lies.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations.
author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

quote: The world of book is the stream of souls.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Reading the Bible will help you get to know the word, but it’s when you put it down and live your life that you get to know the author.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: A good book ... leaves you wanting to reread the book. A great book compels you to reread your own soul.
author: Richard Flanagan,  The Narrow Road to the Deep North

quote: Books wrote our life story, and as they accumulated on our shelves (and on our windowsills, and underneath our sofa, and on top of our refrigerator), they became chapters in it themselves.
author: Anne Fadiman,  Ex Libris: Confessions of a Common Reader
